alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Granville; Vance; Warren (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 31 at 3:00PM EDT until July 31 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Franklin, Granville, Vance and Warren. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Tungsten and Kerr Lake. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Tungsten and Kerr Lake are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Henderson, Warrenton, Norlina, Littleton, Stovall, Middleburg, Macon, Centerville, Afton, Drewry, Wise, Bullocksville, Satterwhite Point Marina, Kerr Lake, Gillburg, South Henderson, Steele Creek Marina & Campground, Dabney, Arcola and Tungsten.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
